ALL OF THEM!
@LintonCaldecott do you have a post in particular.
Cleaning up after Harold - http://www.stumbleupon.com/su/2ooDAD/www.whitehorseinn.org/blog/2011/05/20/cleaning-up-after-harold/

I must admit, this can become a tool to start a conversation about the end and people's current state. I tried it at work the other day and we had some good conversation. Now I hope to continue in that.

I found this debate interesting. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BDbSaxDtah8&feature=related It seemed though that Dr Eric Smaw seemed very unprepared. At least seemed like he did not make any good points?
Seems there were followers of Camping and they seemed to have lost big? http://www.christianpost.com/news/harold-camping-should-publicly-repent-says-christian-leader-50370/

I wonder how many Christians have the guts to say that there is an end, the rapture isn't a joke. Christianity is quite wierd, especially those that don't agree with Rob Bells universal "love wins". Verbally and doctrinally we vehemently disagree, and yet we live and interact with those who we think are going to hell as if Rob Bell is right...
http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/No-rapture-just-a-huge-hotel-bill-20110523 Even some South Africans in the mix.

Personally, I'd love to have a good conversation with any of the followers and get a sense of what they feel and think. I'm not sure if I knew 100% that Jesus was coming tomorrow that I'd toss everything I own away or rack up huge bills anywhere? Don't see the point?
I'm gonna look for if this press conference to see what Harold had to say. Hope it's online somewhere: http://www.aomin.org/aoblog/index.php?itemid=4647

@penkin I was reading something yesterday from a secular perspective & the people they interviewed seemed to be quite philosophical about the whole thing, which surprised me.. Not too many crazy angry people..

@EdwinGarden Here's a pretty sober report http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/150123/20110523/harold-camping-doomsday-may-21st-end-of-the-world-false-prophet-prediction-impact-future-statement-w.htm What stands out to me though is society does not take responsibility? At the end of the of the report where it talks about people possibly suing? Were they not capable of deciding for themselves?
I respect the followers of Mr Camping for their mettle, their resolve. They are willing to stand up for what they believe in the face of HUGE pressure and ridicule. That is worth some respect.

@pevans_om Would you say the same for Muslim extremists? I suppose in a sense you'd have to if the only measure was their devotion to their cause regardless of whether or not it was "right" or not. Standing firm to what you believe in the face of ridicule.
Muslim extremists only face ridicule from thousands of miles away, and mostly don't ever actually have to deal with it day to day. Harold Camping and his followers do.

@LintonCaldecott I suppose there is a difference in standing on a street and being ridiculed face to face. For me it just does not seem like a very unique character that they have? Everyone stands firmly to what they believe? If they don't an argument can be made that they did not believe it. Or is there something I am missing?
A little confused. He is tearful and repentant about misleading people but also is certain about Oct? http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Tearful-SA-rapture-man-seeks-forgiveness-20110525
he says the earth will be destroyed by sulphur and whatever... what about the 7 years of tribulation and like.. the whole of revelations?

@penkin I don't agree. People seem to abandon their beliefs all too easily. Abandoning a belief in the face of ridicule doesn't mean you didn't believe it properly (unless you decide to define belief as something you would die for, but we don't use belief in that way normally).

@pevans_om I suppose. I see it in terms of http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/believe Seems to be if you are really convinced of it's truth you'd stand with it. I think there are people that claim to believe but really don't know what it is? Maybe then when they are confronted and tested they don't stand with it because they never really were convinced of it to start with?

yah, that link about the resurgence, how do you line that up with the limits of God's grace discussion that @pevans_om raised? (mostly the verses used in that topic)
@LintonCaldecott Also not sure what age kids he's talking to?

Ok, that conversation with the kids, it seems to me that it basically says God will be patient with you for ever. And yet, since they used an OT example, that doesn't seem to be the case. How do you teach the other rather final examples, including some in the NT? God ran out of patience this time? But mom, what about what you said the other day, about God always giving chances?

@LintonCaldecott I don't get that. It said, God gives us many chances. I think dealing with kids is hard. We need to "dumb" down things to their level (which is possibly my current lever :P). To me it seems you're inserting into what is said. Not sure we can always take everything and explain it all in one sitting? I don't have any definitive answers. Sorry.
